title: A weekend away with the people who care about historic gardens
text:
After a few years’ absence, I attended the Gardens Trust (formerly Garden History Society) annual conference, held this year at The Queen’s College, Oxford. These occasions are always intensely relaxing, I find, because the daily agenda is so tightly organised (“Be back on the coach by 4pm or we will leave without you”). Being deprived of one’s personal agency for a few days proves an immense relief – there is simply nothing else you can do.

High on the agenda at the AGM was the topic of training local volunteers – members of the county gardens trusts up and down the country – so that they can be effective defenders of historic gardens, at planning inquiries and if necessary in the courts. In...
